ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed and worked on my senior sociology thesis.
I learned a lot more about the IRB process.
I learned how to start writing a thesis!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought that the course was well-designed because it prioritized having time to write and develop each step along the way. I thought that it could have been more rigorous in terms of its standards.
It was a little confusing but I appreciate that the TAs and Prof Wyrtzen were really understanding

I really liked the semi-flexible deadlines we had for certain parts of the thesis--it was a great way of keeping us on track. I also liked that sometimes we had class once every two weeks so that we have time to work on our theses and consult the TA/professor. I also liked that we get to hear about each other's projects and progress in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Sure! Its a good class to keep you accountable for the thesis.
You have to take the course if you are a Sociology major, but it's relatively painless! Probably the best as far thesis colloquiums go.
